text: LuAnn de Lesseps net worth: LuAnn de Lesseps is former nurse, model, author and well known television personality who has a net worth of $25 million. Before becoming a reality TV star, LuAnn de Lesseps worked as a model for Wilhelmina, and has walked runways in Milan and around the world. Before her days as a professional model, LuAnn was a licensed vocational nurse who worked with the elderly in a nursing home. In recent years, LuAnn has credited her time as a nurse for helping her develop people skills. Today LuAnn most famous for being a regular on the Bravo reality television show Real Housewives of New York City. She has been a cast member since the first season. Along with her television, modeling, and nursing career, LuAnn de Lesseps also dabbled as a recording artist and released a single called, "Money Can't Buy You Class." She is also the author of a book titled "Class With the Countess: How to Live with Elegance and Flair," which she later admitted was actually written by a woman named Diane Reverand. As some of you may know, LuAnn de Lesseps is also known as the Countess, due to her marriage to Count Alexandre de Lesseps, in 1993. The couple divorced in 2009 on the grounds of infidelity. They have two children, Victoria and Noel. LuAnn was born in Connecticut, in 1965. Her father was the owner of a construction company, which is still owned by two of LuAnn's brothers. LuAnn has become a prominent television personality and has appeared on several shows, as well as being the host of her own show on WWH Hampton's TV, The Countess Report, and had an acting role in the TV series, Law and Order SUV, as well as Who Wants to be a Millionaire. She has also appeared on shows like, The Tyra Banks Show, The Wendy Williams Show, and The Today Show.
